RECORD.TEXT: 614746156 CTMC 513332 Signed DIS Admission Date : 07/03/1999 Signed EHC9 The patient is a 71-year-old police chief who presents with painless jaundice x1 day . He also noted a 23 pound weight loss in the past 11 months despite having an increased appetite . The patient also complained of fatigue and " feeling down " . Patient denies night sweats in the past month . The patient denies melena , hematochezia , nausea , and abdominal pain . The patient states that he is occasionally constipated . Also denies tenesmus . 1. Type II diabetes mellitus diagnosed 06/94 , well-controlled with last hemoglobin A1C 6.2 2. Vocal cord polyps ALLERGIES : SOCIAL HISTORY : FAMILY HISTORY : Noncontributory . The patient 's father died at the age of 83 of CHF . The patient 's mother is alive at the age of 114y . HOSPITAL COURSE : Abdominal CT while in the Emergency Department revealed likely primary colorectal adenocarcinoma with multiple liver metastases . Hematocrit was 24 in the Emergency Department . Head CT was done with final results pending on discharge . His condition is stable and he was discharged with the following medications : Iron 300 mg p.o. t.i.d. , Glucotrol , Acel 10 mg p.o. q.d. , and Bactrim SS 1 tablet p.o. b.i.d.
